qas.question: What is the Carnival known as in Barbados?
Where did the festival in Barbados originate from?
What year did Crop Over begin?
What activity is done using a greased pole?
What is the finale of Crop Over called?

context: Carnival is known as <a0_0>Crop Over<a0_0/> and is Barbados's biggest festival. Its early beginnings were on the <a1_0>sugar cane plantations<a1_0/> during the colonial period. Crop over began in <a2_0>1688<a2_0/>, and featured singing, dancing and accompaniment by shak-shak, banjo, triangle, fiddle, guitar, bottles filled with water and bones. Other traditions included <a3_0>climbing<a3_0/> a greased pole, feasting and drinking competitions. Originally signaling the end of the yearly cane harvest, it evolved into a national festival. In the late 20th century, Crop Over began to closely mirror the Trinidad Carnival. Beginning in June, Crop Over runs until the first Monday in August when it culminates in the finale, <a4_0>The Grand Kadooment<a4_0/>.
